block.p: Rachel Michelle Etess, the daughter of Lauren Etess-Schwartz of East Hampton, N.Y., and the late Mark Grossinger Etess, was married last evening to Jason Samuel Green, the son of Francine Green and Robert I. Green of Aspen, Colo. Rabbi David Gelfand officiated at the St. Regis in New York.

Mrs. Green, 23, is an associate for business development at Loews Hotels in New York. She graduated from the Cornell School of Hotel Administration. Her father was an owner of Grossinger's, the former Catskills resort, and later the president of the Trump Plaza and the Trump Taj Mahal in Atlantic City. Her stepfather, Steven P. Schwartz, is a real estate developer in New York.

Rachel Michelle Etess, the daughter of Lauren Etess-Schwartz of East Hampton, N.Y., and the late Mark Grossinger Etess, was married last evening to Jason Samuel Green, the son of Francine Green and Robert I. Green of Aspen, Colo. Rabbi David Gelfand officiated at the St. Regis in New York.

Mrs. Green, 23, is an associate for business development at Loews Hotels in New York. She graduated from the Cornell School of Hotel Administration. Her father was an owner of Grossinger's, the former Catskills resort, and later the president of the Trump Plaza and the Trump Taj Mahal in Atlantic City. Her stepfather, Steven P. Schwartz, is a real estate developer in New York.
Mr. Green, 29, is a real estate developer in New York. He graduated from Indiana University. His father is a general partner in the Starwood Group, an investment firm with headquarters in New York.
